original: Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020 3.2 PROJECT DELIVERY AND INSTALLATION As detailed in a SOW hereto, Developer will provide certain Services, Deliverables and Documentation to Client upon a designated Milestone in accordance with such Milestone's specific Specifications (collectively, Specific Specifications). Prior to completing a Milestone, Developer will: (a) inform Client of the availability of each portion of a Deliverable otherwise required be delivered by such Milestone date for testing by Client (he Acceptance Test Date); and (b) deliver to Client sue Deliverable (each a Milestone Deliverable) including the source code and object code form compatible with the platform(s) described in the SOW for such Milestone Deliverable.

Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020 3.2 PROJECT DELIVERY AND INSTALLATION As outlined in the Statement of Work (SOW) attached, Client will specify certain requirements, deliverables, and documentation to Developer upon reaching a designated Milestone in accordance with those Milestone's specific terms (hereinafter "Milestone Specifications"). Prior to reaching a Milestone, Developer shall:

(a) Notify Client of the readiness of each portion of a Deliverable required to be delivered by such Milestone date for testing by Developer (hereinafter "Acceptance Test Date") and make those portions available for Client's review; and

(b) Receive from Client, upon request, any Milestone Deliverable (each a Milestone Deliverable), including the source code and object code form compatible with the platform(s) described in the SOW for such Milestone Deliverable. The onus is on Developer to ensure compatibility with Client's systems.

Intellectual Property 6.1 WORK MADE FOR HIRE AND ASSIGNMENT OF RIGHTS Except as otherwise detailed in this Agreement, the Parties acknowledge and agree that the Subject Program including without limitation the Deliverables and Documentation (collectively, the Works) are "work made for hire" in accordance with the U.S. Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. § 101 et seq. Accordingly, Client will be the copyright author and owner of all of the Works. To the extent permissible, Developer hereby assigns and transfers to Client all copyright and other intellectual property ownership in the Works. Developer agrees to assist Client, as well as execute any documents reasonably necessary, to perfect the assignment of such rights to Client. Developer acknowledges and agrees that the payment of Fees and a Bonus (if any), as referenced in Section 5 of this Agreement, shall be the full consideration to Developer for the assignment of rights herein.

6. Intellectual Property Ownership and Developer's Rights
6.1 WORK MADE FOR HIRE AND TRANSFER OF RIGHTS
Except as otherwise detailed in this Agreement, the Parties acknowledge and agree that the Subject Program including without limitation the Deliverables and Documentation (collectively, the Works) are "work made for hire" in accordance with the U.S. Copyright Act, 17 U.S.C. § 101 et seq. Accordingly, Developer will be the copyright author and owner of all of the Works. To the extent permissible, Client hereby assigns and transfers to Developer all copyright and other intellectual property ownership in the Works. Developer agrees to assist Client, as well as execute any documents reasonably necessary, to perfect the assignment of such rights to Developer. Developer acknowledges and agrees that the payment of Fees and a Bonus (if any), as referenced in Section 5 of this Agreement, shall be the full consideration received by Developer for the transfer of rights herein.

In this revised clause, the ownership and assignment of intellectual property rights have been reversed between the Developer and Client. The Developer will now own the copyright and other intellectual property rights in the Works, while the Client transfers these rights to the Developer. The payment structure remains unchanged.

original: Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020 6.4 CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE 6.4.1 Confidential Information.  Each Party acknowledges and agrees that it will receive confidential information and trade secrets from the other Party in otherwise carrying out the actions contemplated by this Agreement (collective, Confidential Information). Confidential Information does not include information at: (a) is available to the public or that becomes available to the public through no act or failure to act by the receiving Party (Receiving Party); (b) is known to the Receiving Party prior to the date of disclosure by the disclosing Party (Disclosing Party), unless the Receiving Party agreed to keep such information in confidence at the time of receipt of the information; (c) is properly obtained hereafter from a source that is not under an obligation of confidentiality with respect to such information; or (d) is developed independently by the Receiving Party without reference to or use of the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020
6.4. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE
6.4.1 Confidential Information. Each Party recognizes and consents to the fact that it may come into possession of confidential information and proprietary knowledge from the other Party during the performance of duties outlined in this Agreement (collectively, Confidential Information). It is acknowledged that Confidential Information does not comprise:
(a) data which is publicly accessible or will become so due to actions or inactions on the part of the party receiving the information (Recipient);
(b) information known by the Recipient prior to its disclosure by the other party (Discloser), except where such information was subject to a confidentiality agreement at the time of receipt;
(c) data legally acquired from sources not bound by confidentiality obligations regarding such information; or
(d) information independently developed by the Recipient without reference to or reliance on the Discloser's Confidential Information.

In this revised clause, the obligation for maintaining the confidentiality of information has shifted slightly towards the Receiver, making it more explicit that the Recipient recognizes and consents to receiving confidential information, and acknowledges the existence of such information without an explicit agreement to keep it confidential in certain instances.

original: 6.4.2 Non-Disclosure.  Neither Party shall use or disclose Confidential Information of the other Party to any third party, without the written consent of the Disclosing Party of such Confidential Information. Receiving Party agrees to undertake reasonable measures to maintain and preserve the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party in confidence, which measures shall be no less than the measures taken by the Receiving Party to protect its own confidential information and in no vent shall be less than reasonable care. Upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, Receiving Party will immediately destroy or erase all copies of documents or materials containing any Confidential Information provided by Disclosing Party and, upon the Disclosing Party's request, promptly confirm destruction of same by signing and returning to the Disclosing Party a certificate of destruction reasonably satisfactory to the Disclosing Party.
modified: 6.4.2 Confidentiality Obligations. Each Party reserves the right to share Confidential Information with third parties, provided such sharing is necessary for the performance of this Agreement and subject to the receiving party's compliance with Section 6.4.3. The Receiving Party shall employ reasonable efforts to safeguard and protect the Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party, taking measures at least equivalent to those applied to its own confidential information. Upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, the Receiving Party will retain all copies of documents or materials containing the Confidential Information for a period of three years, unless required by law to keep them for a longer period. During this retention period, the Receiving Party shall restrict access to such Confidential Information and maintain strict security measures. Upon the Disclosing Party's request, the Receiving Party shall provide a written statement confirming these practices and restrictions. At the end of the retention period or upon the Disclosing Party's request at any time, the Receiving Party will securely delete or permanently anonymize all copies of documents or materials containing Confidential Information provided by the Disclosing Party, unless required by law to retain them for a longer period.

original: 6.4.3 Derivatives.  All Confidential Information, and any Derivatives thereof whether created by Client or Developer, remain the property of the Disclosing Party and no license or other rights to any Confidential Information or Derivatives is granted or implied hereby. For purposes of this Agreement, Derivatives shall mean: (a) for copyrightable or copyrighted material, any translation, abridgment, revision or other form in which an existing work may be recast, transformed or adapted ;(b) for patentable or patented material, any improvement thereon; and (c) for material which is protected by trade secret, any new material derived from such existing trade secret material, including new material which may be protected under applicable copyright, patent, or trade secret law.
ollama_generated:
6.4.3 Derivatives and Ownership. Any Derivatives, whether created by Client or Developer, shall be considered the exclusive property of the Disclosing Party. The Agreement does not convey nor imply any license or rights to the Confidential Information or Derivatives. For clarity's sake, Derivatives are defined herein as:

(a) for copyrightable or copyrighted material, any modifications, adaptations, expansions, or other variations of an existing work;
(b) for patentable or patented material, any enhancements, advancements, or modifications thereon; and
(c) for material protected by trade secret, any new material resulting from the utilization, development, or application of such existing trade secret material, including but not limited to, new material that may be protected under applicable copyright, patent, or trade secret law.

In this Agreement, it is understood that all Derivatives are the property of the Disclosing Party, and no rights to them are granted or implied to the Client or Developer.

original: 6.4.4 Notification of Suspected Disclosure.  The Receiving Party further agrees to immediately notify Disclosing Party of any actual or suspected misuse misappropriation, or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information, which may come to Receiving Party's attention.
ollama_generated: 6.4.4 Notification of Potential Use of Confidential Information. The Receiving Party acknowledges a reasonable timeframe for reviewing potential uses of the Confidential Information and agrees to promptly inform Disclosing Party if, within such reasonable timeframe, any actual or suspected misuse, misappropriation, or unauthorized disclosure of Confidential Information becomes apparent.

Warranties and Representations 9.1 CLIENT Client represents, warrants and covenants that: (a) Client is a duly organized, validly existing and in good standing (b) Client has the full right and legal author y to enter into and fully perform its duties and obligations under this Agreement; (c) Client owns all right, title, and interest in, or otherwise has full right and authority to permit Developer's use of Content, Marks, Procedures and Client's Confidential Information, as detailed in this Agreement; (d) is solely responsible for compliance with all federal, ate, and local laws, rules, regulations, executive orders, ordinances, standards, and best practices applicable to Client's business or industry; and (e) Client will comply with all federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, executive orders, ordinances, standards, and best practices applicable to Client's business or industry.

9. Warranties and Representations
9.1 DEVELOPER Developer represents, warrants, and covenants that: (a) Developer is a duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing; (b) Developer has the full right and legal authority to enter into this Agreement and perform its duties and obligations, but shall not be held responsible for any liabilities or damages arising from Client's breach of these terms or its failure to comply with any applicable laws; (c) Developer owns all rights, title, and interest in, or has the right to use, the Developer's Content, Marks, Procedures, and Confidential Information, as detailed in this Agreement. However, Developer shall not be liable for any claims arising from Client's unauthorized use of such materials; (d) The Client is solely responsible for compliance with all federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, executive orders, ordinances, standards, and best practices applicable to the Client's business or industry. Developer shall have no obligation to ensure Client's compliance with these requirements; (e) The Client will comply with all federal, state, and local laws, rules, regulations, executive orders, ordinances, standards, and best practices applicable to its business or industry, but the Developer shall not be liable for any damages or claims arising from the Client's non-compliance.

original: 10.2 DEVELOPER Developer shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Client, its members owners, officers, employees, independent contractors and agents, from and against all losses, claims, liabilities or damages and any related costs and expenses, including attorneys' fees and costs arising out of, or in any way related to any claim or action against Client arising out of or in any way related to: (a) Developer's material breach of his Agreement; (b) Developer's gross negligence or willful misconduct; (c) De eloper's act or omission constituting a violation of applicable federal, state, local law or regulation; or (d) any claim made against Client asserting a violation of any third party intellectual property right pertaining to the Subject Program.

Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020 10.3 NON DISPARAGEMENT CLAUSE The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates.

Revised Clause:
Source: PELICAN DELIVERS, INC., S-1, 2/11/2020
10.3 RESTRICTED COMMENT CLAUSE

The Designer and the Client acknowledge and consent to abstain from making derogatory or defamatory statements about each other or their respective affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees, or shareholders, in any form, including but not limited to written, oral, or online communications. It is further understood that any previous negative comments made prior to this agreement will be retracted if necessary.

Both parties also undertake to exercise reasonable efforts to ensure that their respective employees or agents refrain from expressing disparaging sentiments regarding the other party or its associated entities as defined in this section. For the purpose of this Section, "disparage" shall encompass any statement or action that may harm the reputation or standing of Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC., or their affiliates.

In case of violation of this clause, the non-offending party reserves the right to take appropriate legal action to protect its interests.

original: Dave Comeau 5452 Pineridge Drive Bremerton, WA 983 360-731-6611 12.3 SEVERABILITY If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of law to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable: (a) that provision shall be deemed amended to achieve s nearly as possible the same economic and/or protective effect as the original provision; and (b) the legality, validity and enforceability of the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall not be affected or impaired thereby.
ollama_generated: 12.3 MODIFICATION UPON CHALLENGE: In the event that any provision within this Agreement is deemed by a court of law to be unlawful, invalid, or non-enforceable: (a) said provision will be modified and interpreted so as to approach, as closely as possible, the original intent in terms of economic implications and protective measures; (b) this Agreement's remaining provisions shall not be affected or undermined by such a determination. In essence, if any part of this Agreement is found unenforceable, it will be amended to preserve its intended purpose while leaving the enforceability of the rest of the agreement intact.
